question.body: Which of the following is incorrectly paired?

multiple_choice.choice: somatic – stretch receptor located in tendon (tendons connect muscle to bone)

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is correctly paired; these receptors can detect temperature changes and pain from tissue damage in the skin. They are also found in organ capsules.
Incorrect. This is correctly paired; this receptor can help prevent damage by initiating reflexes that prevent overstretching of tendons.
Correct. Tactile receptors would be in the epidermis and dermis of the skin, so they would be associated with the somatic sense, not visceral senses.
Incorrect. This is correctly paired; this receptor detects the filling and emptying of the stomach to coordinate the digestive process.

part.hint: One way of classifying receptors is by location; whether they are located in integumentary and skeleto-muscular system or in the other visceral body systems. Keep in mind that some receptor types can be found in organs of both categories.
